comments:
Tried to do some workspace config while offline today and ran into an odd usability problem -- the 'no network present' configuration scenario.

a) installing mylar from an existing .eclipseextension folder (existing update site install) via Help > Software Updates > Manage Configuration > Add an Extension Location 

b) restart eclipse when prompted

c) Errors are thrown in PDE Error log view; Mylar views won't open (eg., Task List, Task Repositories)

!ENTRY org.eclipse.mylar.core 1 0 2007-07-23 19:08:01.639
!MESSAGE Mylar: Could not load handler: org.eclipse.mylar.internal.tasks.ui.RepositoryAwareStatusHandler must implement org.eclipse.mylar.context.core.AbstractContextStructureBridge

Forgot to mention, this is with Eclipse 3.3 (the PDT All In One 1.0.0.v20070712), plus PDE, Mylar + some other plugins (like EclipseColorer and ShellEd).

Linux GTK (MEPIS 6.0, kernel 2.6.15-27-686 #2 SMP)
IBM JDK 5.0
Mylyn 2.0.0.v20070514-1800

!SESSION 2007-07-23 19:07:47.160 -----------------------------------------------
eclipse.buildId=I20070625-1500

We should not be doing any network I/O on startup, and I frequently start Mylyn in various configurations with no network, so it seems unlikely to me that this is related to the network not being present.  I'm more suspicious about this being a first Update Manager based restart and the presence of an extension location.  Note that we know of potential warnings appearing (bug 188254) so this could be a related startup timeout scenario.  Can you reproduce this with the network active?

(In reply to comment #2)
> We should not be doing any network I/O on startup, and I frequently start Mylyn
> in various configurations with no network, so it seems unlikely to me that this
> is related to the network not being present.  I'm more suspicious about this
> being a first Update Manager based restart and the presence of an extension
> location.  Note that we know of potential warnings appearing (bug 188254) so
> this could be a related startup timeout scenario.  Can you reproduce this with
> the network active?

Well, it manifests when there's no network, but subsequent restarts are also screwed -- once the problem happens it stays happening. 

Updating from a 200705 version to the latest available on the Mylar update site seems to have fixed things. I'll try to reproduce this with the latest Mylar pre-installed to an .exclipseextension folder, then adding that to a fresh eclipse 3.3 install. Or, from an offline install (zipped UM site) with no network.

(In reply to comment #2)
> bug 188254

Are you sure that's the right bug? 

Anyway, I can't reproduce this with a clean 3.3 workspace and the version of Mylar in Europa. I did however find a typo in one of your properties strings:

"Synchronizying queries for Eclipse.org"

But clearly you're aware of this one (http://wiki.eclipse.org/Mylyn_UI_Nits#Synchronization), so I guess this bug can be closed as WORKSFORME. 

Sorry for the churn, must be my mangled workspace.

(In reply to comment #4)
> Are you sure that's the right bug?

Nope, sorry!  We need to add content assist for bug IDs to the task editor ;)  I meant bug 188524.  I'll mark this as a duplicate of that one, but will be watching for something like this very carefully because it could indicate that a mangled workspace causes a timing problem that turns the warning into an error (although that has not been noticed before).

Typo fixed, thanks.

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of bug 188524 ***
